page.title: 10Special Education in Hexham.
page.content: {Hackwood Park}is a special school for children with moderate learning difficuties.They have 83 children aged 4\-19,with 11 teachers and 1 head.Some children board on week days.The school was purpose built in 1975 on park land on the outskirts of Hexham and takes pupils from Tynedale and south and west Northumberland.The aim of the school is to train the children to look after themselves. {The Priory School}is a special school for children with severe difficulties in learning.There are 36 children aged 2-19,5 staff,1 head,5 nursery nurses canteen ladies and people to look after residential children at Stelling Hall.There are holiday schemes for some with home problems.5 classrooms are used for a variety of subjects,and they enjoy music and outdoor activity. They aim to do more things themselves.
